thread.section_title: News Archive - News, sport and travel archive - Telegraph
thread.title: Travel programmes on TV

author: Simon Horsford
title: Travel programmes on TV
text: Friday September 18 Terry and Mason's Great Food Trip (BBC Two, 6.30pm) Terry Wogan and Mason McQueen abandon the cab for a punt along the River Cherwell in Oxford. Wigan visits the city's old jail and they investigate the origins of the Oxford sausage and the famous old Oxford marmalade factory, before meeting students at the university who have formed a society to assess the scientific benefits of pizza. Iolo's Great Welsh Parks (BBC Two, 7.00pm) Naturalist Iolo Williams explores the park in Pontypool, which was given to the community by industrialists, the Hanbury family. Along the way he discovers thousands of nesting bees and the rare native crayfish, as well as finding out about the otters that live in the river and how to identify the sex of maybugs. Last in the series 21 Punts on the River Cherwell in Oxford Photo: Fotolia/AP Rick Stein: From Venice to Istanbul (BBC Two, 9.30pm) The chef's gastronomic road trip reaches a conclusion as he arrives in Istanbul, just in time for the bluefish season, which allows him the chance to enjoy a fishing expedition on the Bosphorus, one of the world's most strategic waterways, which divides the city into two continents. Stein also cooks two much-loved local dishes - lavish kofte kebabs with pistachios, and kapuska, a hearty traditional Turkish cuisine stew from the Black Sea region, whose name is derived from the Russian word for cabbage. Saturday September 19 Galapagos - Islands of Change: Natural World (BBC Two, 7.30pm) David Attenborough narrates a documentary that looks at the impact increased migration and tourism has had on the Pacific archipelago's wildlife. Repeat. Istanbul, Turkey Photo: Fotolia/AP Monday September 21 Coast (BBC Two, 4.45pm) In Tyneside, Neil Oliver challenges the women of Cullercoats to drag a heavy lifeboat over miles of headland in an effort to re-create a rescue allegedly carried out by their ancestors nearly 150 years previously. Dick Strawbridge meets Sunderland riveters who were responsible for building some of north-east England's characteristic cargo ships, and Miranda Krestovnikoff visits Bass Rock in the Firth of Forth. Repeat. Terry and Mason's Great Food Trip (BBC Two, 6.45pm) Terry Wogan and Mason McQueen arrive in the Roman city of Bath, where they seek out the finest delicacies, from beetroot sorbet to honey glazed dormice. A reviving brew served by the UK's reigning king of the baristas sets them up for a visit to the catacombs where an eco food initiative is making mushrooms out of waste cardboard and coffee grounds. This Wild Life (BBC Two, 7.00pm) Saba's guests are accidentally stranded at a remote airstrip in the scorching African, as the summer heats up, and the race is on to pick them up, while Saba prepares the camp for their arrival. Meanwhile, husband Frank puts himself on the frontline in the fight against ivory poachers. St Peterburg, Russia Photo: Fotolia/AP Tuesday September 22 Terry and Mason's Great Food Trip (BBC Two, 6.00pm) Mason McQueen's black cab takes Terry Wogan to the Victorian spa town of Harrogate in North Yorkshire, where they enjoy a Turkish bath and drink inordinate amounts of tea. They also sample a toffee that is actually a barley sugar, visit Agatha Christie's hide-out hotel and enjoy a slap-up dinner - with Yorkshire pudding for desert. Great Continental Railway Journeys (BBC Four, 7.30pm) Michael Portillo continues his journey through Spain and Portugal, learning about Britain's alliance with the Portuguese, and concluding this leg of his trip in the capital Lisbon. Repeat. The Hairy Bikers' Northern Exposure (BBC Two, 8.00pm) The bikers head for Finland hoping for a change of pace from the intensity of St Petersburg, and they immediately fall in love with the tranquil and beautiful lakes. Dave Myers learns how to enjoy a traditional Finnish sauna experience, while Si King cooks up some Finnish pastries, before things take a more hectic turn as they ride tanks through the forest, learn about the national pastime of wife-carrying and meet a priest who has given his service a heavy metal twist. Britain's Biggest Adventures with Bear Grylls (ITV1, 9.00pm) The adventurer continues to explore the UK's natural history, abseiling at Malham Cove in the Yorkshire Dales and getting into danger in a flooding cave. Malham has long attracted tourists and geologists alike to wonder at its beauty and history, as well as walkers attracted to the limestone formation and its surrounding pathways, and Grylls reveals a tropical past to one of North Yorkshire's finest features. Malham Cove, Yorkshire Dales Photo: Fotolia/AP Penelope Keith's Hidden Villages (More4, 9.00pm) The actress travels through the South Downs and the Weald of Sussex and Kent, reliving the Cuckfield Donkey Races and delving into the life of Rudyard Kipling. The Hotel Inspector Returns (Five, 10.00pm) Alex Polizzi returns to the Caspian in Ealing Broadway, west London for a third time. Iranian mother-and-son team Nousha and Samandar were fighting to make a profit, and the addition of Samandar's sister Guissa to the family business led to squabbling. Will Alex finally manage to turn the hotel's fortunes around? Wednesday September 23 Africa (BBC Two, 3.45pm) David Attenborough explores the vast and diverse continent, aiming to show its landscapes and wildlife as they have never been seen before. He begins in the Kalahari desert, Africa's south-west corner, where clever meerkats are outsmarted by a wily bird's use of mimicry, a solitary rhino is seen to exhibit previously unknown sociable behaviours, terrifying insects prey on baby birds and the rarest fish in the world is filmed for the first time. In the neighbouring Namib desert, which receives almost no rain, the competition for scant resources can be fierce. Repeat. Kalahari Desert in Namibia Photo: Fotolia/AP Thursday September 24 Terry and Mason's Great Food Trip (BBC Two, 6.00pm) Terry Wogan and Mason McQueen arrive in Birmingham and take in the sights and sounds of the Bull Ring market, where they feast on the finest dim sum. They then go a canal trip through the heart of the city - leading to an impromptu ballet lesson for Mason - and head to the famous Balti Triangle, where they help to create a special Irish curry. Friday September 25 Terry and Mason's Great Food Trip (BBC Two, 6.00pm) Mason McQueen and Terry Wogan head to Marlow, where they are intrigued to discover the historic Buckinghamshire town boasts many food producers and restaurants. The duo are served up a dish by Michelin-starred chef Atul Kochhar, treated to a pub lunch by Tom Kerridge and after Mason has a go at rowing on the River Thames, it's time to sample the county's regional dish of Bacon Badger. Patagonia - Earth's Secret Paradise (BBC Two, 9.00pm) A glimpse at the rarely seen South America wilderness, home to a range of creatures from the Andes Mountains to Cape Horn. Cameras reveal the secret lives of pumas and hummingbirds, soar with condors over glacial peaks and explore monkey puzzle forests dating back to the time of the dinosaurs. The extreme kayakers who gain thrills and excitement from traversing the area's raging waterfalls are observed, as are the native cowboys, known as gauchos, as they round up wild horses. Narrated by Santiago Cabrera. An aerial view of the Andes Mountains Photo: Fotolia/AP Telegraphtravel Follow @telegraphtravel
